questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a will?
options: Distribute assets according to your wishes
questions.explanation: A will ensures your assets are distributed according to your wishes after death.

questions.question: Which estate planning tool avoids probate?
questions.explanation: Assets held in a living trust avoid probate, while assets distributed by a will go through probate.

questions.question: Estate taxes only apply to very wealthy individuals.
questions.explanation: Federal estate tax exemption is quite high (over $12 million in 2023), so it only affects very wealthy estates.

questions.question: What is a durable power of attorney?
options: A document that lets someone make medical decisions
A document that lets someone manage your finances if you're incapacitated
questions.explanation: A durable power of attorney allows someone to manage your financial affairs if you become incapacitated.

questions.question: Why are beneficiary designations important?
options: They determine who gets your stuff
questions.explanation: Beneficiary designations on accounts like IRAs and life insurance override instructions in wills and trusts.

questions.question: Healthcare directives are only for elderly people.
questions.explanation: Anyone can become incapacitated at any age, so healthcare directives are important for adults of all ages.

questions.question: What is the unlimited marital deduction?
options: You can deduct unlimited mortgage interest
Assets transferred to a spouse are estate tax-free
questions.explanation: Assets transferred to a US citizen spouse at death are exempt from estate taxes due to the unlimited marital deduction.

questions.question: When should business owners create a succession plan?
questions.explanation: Business owners should create succession plans early to ensure smooth transitions and protect the business value.

questions.question: Joint tenancy with right of survivorship avoids probate.
questions.explanation: Joint tenancy passes assets directly to the surviving joint tenant, avoiding probate for those assets.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of life insurance in estate planning?
options: It provides liquidity for estate expenses
It eliminates the need for a will
questions.explanation: Life insurance provides cash to pay estate taxes, debts, and other expenses without having to sell illiquid assets.
